overview.purpose: Structured extraction of NCCN patient guideline recommendations to serve as a rule/knowledge base for personalized breast cancer treatment planning (Stages 0–IV).
overview.notes: Content extracted and structured from provided NCCN patient guideline PDFs (2025 editions). Use for building rule engine and evidence-mapping.

general_tests: Diagnostic mammogram and other imaging as needed
Genetic counseling and testing if at risk (germline BRCA etc.)
Distress screening and lymphedema baseline screening

key_points: Staging uses TNM and receptor (HR/HER2) status.
Clinical stage (cTNM) before treatment; pathologic stage (pTNM) after surgery.

initial_choices: Endocrine therapy ± CDK4/6 inhibitor (abemaciclib, palbociclib, ribociclib)
Consider olaparib/talazoparib for germline BRCA mutations
For PIK3CA mutation: alpelisib + fulvestrant (as indicated)

preferred: Trastuzumab-based regimens; 1 year of trastuzumab when indicated
residual_disease_options: Ado-trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) for residual disease after neoadjuvant therapy
Trastuzumab ± pertuzumab to complete 1 year if T-DM1 discontinued for toxicity

preferred_first_line: For PD-L1 CPS ≥10: pembrolizumab + chemotherapy (albumin-bound paclitaxel / paclitaxel / gemcitabine+carboplatin)
If germline BRCA mutation: consider PARP inhibitor or platinum-based chemo
residual_disease: Capecitabine for residual disease after certain neoadjuvant regimens

preoperative_neoadjuvant: Consider for large tumors, node-positive disease, or cases needing tumor shrinkage before surgery.
Core biopsy, placement of clips, axillary imaging/biopsy recommended before starting.
postoperative_adjuvant: Adjuvant systemic therapy depends on pathologic stage, nodal status, HR/HER2.
Endocrine therapy typically given for HR+ disease after other systemic therapy as indicated.

guide_summary: Preferred regimens include paclitaxel + trastuzumab; TCH; TCHP.
If no preoperative therapy or no residual disease, complete up to 1 year trastuzumab; pertuzumab may be added.
If residual disease after preop therapy, consider ado-trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) or trastuzumab ± pertuzumab.

supportive_care: Manage side effects proactively; report new/worsening symptoms promptly.
survivorship: Provide personalized survivorship care plan listing late effects, follow-up tests, and coordination with primary care.

input_features_required: Tumor features: size (T), nodes (N), metastasis (M), grade, histology
Receptor status: ER, PR, HER2, PD-L1 (if applicable)
Genetic biomarkers: germline BRCA, PIK3CA, ESR1, AKT1, PTEN, MSI, TMB, NTRK fusions
Prior treatments and response (neoadjuvant response / residual disease)
Patient preferences (fertility preservation, goals of care)
rule_outputs: Rationale and citation pointer to guideline section

example_1.if: HR+ AND HER2- AND postmenopausal AND node_negative
example_1.then: Consider endocrine therapy ± 21-gene assay to decide benefit from adjuvant chemo; consider CDK4/6 if high-risk features

example_2.then: Recommend trastuzumab-based chemo + pertuzumab-containing regimen preop or postop as per guide
